poem:
**At the Gates of St. Paul's**

In the shadow of the cathedral dome,   
Gods of Mammon gather where prayers once echoed,   
lingering over whispers of investments and returns.   
The King's toast mingles with the city's breath,   
a tapestry of suits and ambition,   
while the cathedral doors stay closed,   
secrets tucked beneath ancient stone.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rachel Reeves gives closing speech at UK investment summit – business live 6.03pm BST St Paul's Cathedral is closed off so that the Gods of Mammon can attend a party hosted by the Ling and Prime Minister. pic.twitter.com/ESRTWBV5qI— ianVisits (@ianvisits) October 14, 2024 (I think “Ling” should be “King”) 5.54pm BST Danni Hewson, AJ Bell head of financial analysis, isn’t surprised to hear that the government raised a record amount of new investment today. She". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
